intro: Monnina latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled bluemink, is a perennial herb native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Monnina latisepala is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
